result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda A Sutton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond shall be applied.  Any remaining amount due shall be paid as a condition of probation in count 6.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Court is not opposed to sentence being served at a jail convenient to the defendants place of employment or residence.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence being served

miscConds.notes: Bond shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall have no contact with Patricia LaBuda or Pat's Jiffy Stop.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment and treatment.

Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or full time school, or a combination of the two equal to full time status.
